intro: Flemingia macrophylla var. philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine flemingia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in lowland forests. Its leaves are large and trifoliate, while its flowers are small and clustered in racemes. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has traditional uses in local communities.
